cause.description:
United Communities Against Poverty, Inc. (UCAP) is the designated Community Action Agency for Prince George's County, Maryland. Since 1964, UCAP's programs and services have assisted the homeless, the low-income, and those living in poverty throughout Prince George's County. UCAP has helped low-income residents achieve self-sufficiency by providing utility assistance and housing services. All eligible customers must completye an in-take assessment packet which pincludes personal information such as name, address, and income status. All customers must have a valid ID, proof of income, and supporting documentation to validate county residence; however, a small fee is charged for books and some supplies. All fees are based on a sliding scale acording to income. Fees are waived for those with no income.
1. Alleviate poverty.
2. Improve community relations.
3. Maximize the quality of life for the diverse residents of Prince George's County.
cause.mission: United Communities Against Poverty, Inc., (UCAP) serves the homeless, those living in poverty, and the low-income residents striving to reach self-sufficiency in Prince George's County.
